thread.title: Mets notes: Matt Harvey on the docket for Game 5 - Baseball
thread.title_full: Mets notes: Matt Harvey on the docket for Game 5 - Baseball - NorthJersey.com

author: MATT EHALT
title: Mets notes: Matt Harvey on the docket for Game 5 - Baseball
text:
CHICAGO â€” While manager Terry Collins has expressed uncertainty about Matt Harvey's availability, he said "it looks like" Harvey will be available to start Game 5, if necessary.
"He's a lot better today," Collins said before Game 3 of the NLCS.
The concerns about Harvey stem from him taking a liner off his right triceps during his Game 1 start Saturday. The triceps was swollen afterward, but Harvey has improved.
The right-hander threw a side session before Tuesday's game and said he felt fine. He defeated the Cubs by throwing 7 2/3 innings of two-run ball in Game 1. 
MATZ'S TURN: Steven Matz makes his second postseason start tonight in Game 4. He allowed three runs in five innings in his playoff debut during the division series against the Dodgers.
Matz will be pitching on seven days' rest.
"It hasn't been too challenging," Matz said of not starting on regular rest. "I'm still able to get my work in between starts. You know you're not on necessarily a routine as much as you were during the regular season. I'm still able to get my work in, and I still feel fresh for each start."
Against the Dodgers, Matz had just one bad inning in which he allowed all three runs. He surrendered six hits on 85 pitches.
Pitching coach Dan Warthen said Monday the team considered starting Matz in Game 2 of this series, but opted for Noah Syndergaard when Syndergaard said he felt fine after a relief appearance in Los Angeles.
Matz hopes to build off the success the team's other starters have had.
"[The Cubs] look like a tough lineup. They're a bunch of young, fiery guys," Matz said. "Matt and Noah have done a great job the first two games, so I'm just going to watch Jacob [deGrom on Tuesday night], see how he attacks them, and try to build off those guys."
